p: The container of the main content. It can be center, left or right aligned.

scss: // elements with smaller order will go to the front, with equal orders will go with the origin order in markup.

// more detail about orders please refer to http://the-echoplex.net/flexyboxes/?fixed-height=on&legacy=on&display=flex&flex-direction=row&flex-wrap=nowrap&justify-content=flex-start&align-items=flex-start&align-content=stretch&order[]=0&flex-grow[]=0&flex-shrink[]=1&flex-basis[]=auto&align-self[]=auto&order[]=0&flex-grow[]=0&flex-shrink[]=1&flex-basis[]=auto&align-self[]=auto&order[]=0&flex-grow[]=0&flex-shrink[]=1&flex-basis[]=auto&align-self[]=auto

p: ^liquid-2$ is for creating a two columns layout: a fluid column with a fixed one. Similar with grid, you can use list or map as a parameter to set up the layout.
^liquid-3$ is for creating a holy-grail layout: a fluid column with 2 fixed columns.
^gallery$ is for creating picture galleries.
^masonry$ is for creating masonry layouts with pure css.
^metro$ is for creating block layout inspired by Windows 8. Use nested ^metro$ to make complex layout.

scss: // 3: 1st child -> 3 blocks width x 3 blocks height
// 1: 2nd child -> 1 blocks width x 1 blocks height
// h2: 3rd child -> 1 blocks width x 2 blocks height
// 1: 4th child -> 1 blocks width x 1 blocks height
// w3: 5th child -> 3 blocks width x 1 blocks height

html: <!-- 'wrapper' could be any valid class name -->
<!-- 'diamond' could be any valid class name -->
scss: // diamond size: 20% (could be fixed value like 200px too)

p: Create ^angled-edges$ layout. ^background$ could be image, gradient or pure color, but the background of sibling elements must be pure color.
Create ^sticky-footer$ to prevent layout collapse when content is less, e.g. 404 page.
^justify$ is for creating ^justify$ layout.
^center$ is for creating both horizontal and vertical center aligned layout.
Pure css responsive charts. Currently only include ^bar$ and ^column$, more types will be added soon.

scss: // animation: 0.6s ease (add class '.active' to charts to show animation)

p: Solutions for display a complex data table on small screen.

Referance: 
 http://dbushell.com/2012/01/05/responsive-tables-2/, 
 https://github.com/nadangergeo/RWD-Table-Patterns
responsive-table.capability: Flip-scroll: IE 10+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 4+, Opera 12.1+
Scroll: IE 10+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 4+, Opera 10.6+
Toggle: IE 8+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 10.6+
Stack: IE 10+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 4+, Opera 10.6+

scss: @include rp-table('stack' 'bp' 900 #dbdbdb 'data' ("First Name", "Last Name", "Job Title", "Favorite Color", "Wars or Trek?", "Porn Name", "Date of Birth", "Dream Vacation City", "GPA", "Arbitrary Data")) {

p: Pure css off-canvas with multiple modes.

html: <!-- modes: slide-in, rotate-in, rotate-out, rotate-in-reverse, push, drawer -->
<!-- modes: slide-along, slide-out, scale-down, scale-up, open-door, reveal -->
<!-- 1. Add [data-has-submenu] to parent item, [data-submenu] to submenu. -->
<!-- 2. Place a checkbox and label before submenu, connect them by [for] and [id]. -->
scss: // mode: slide-in; (slide-in | slide-along | slide-out | rotate-in | rotate-out | rotate-in-reverse | scale-down | scale-up | open-door | push | reveal | drawer)

p: Html5 form validation using H5F https://github.com/ryanseddon/H5F. We already include H5F in ^kit.js$ (with a little bit modification), so you don't need download it again.
Set your customized alerts information through ^<div data-info=""></div>$.

html: User name must be at least 6 characters.
<!-- normal: you can use button on any tag -->
<!-- push: inner span tag, data-text attribute -->

Thanks Nicolas Gallagher http://nicolasgallagher.com/css-drop-shadows-without-images/ for the idea.

Pure css push toggle.

p: Radios or checkboxes' active style.

Customize ^input[type="file"]$. 
 Thanks Osvaldas Valutis http://tympanus.net/codrops/2015/09/15/styling-customizing-file-inputs-smart-way/ for the idea.

html: <input type="file" name="file" id="file" class="inputfile" data-multiple-caption="{count} files selected" multiple />

html: Well, the way they make shows is, they make one show. That show's called a pilot. Then they show that show to the people who make shows, and on the strength of that one show they decide if they're going to make more shows.

p: ^media-list$ displays a media object (images, video, audio) to the left or right of a block object.

html: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Nam animi tempore harum dignissimos error maxime, porro, quis dolorum laboriosam recusandae officia repudiandae natus mollitia id amet voluptatibus. Quibusdam, facilis! Hic.

p: ^type$ is a shorthand mixin for type.

scss: h1 { @include type(20px 'Georgia, Helvetica, sans-serif' center 1.4 bold italic); }

// $ro-font-weights: thin, hairline, 'extra light', 'ultra light', lighter, light, normal, medium, 'semi bold', 'demi bold', bold, bolder, 'extra bold', black, heavy, 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, weight-normal, weight-inherit !default;
// $ro-text-transforms: capitalize, uppercase, lowercase, none, full-width, transform-inherit !default;

p:
Stolen from http://www.sassmeister.com/gist/7f22e44ace49b5124eec 
 More on https://blog.codepen.io/2016/10/31/fluid-type-blogs/.
syntax: $properties: properties which have the same fluid value
$data: a map with two pairs of viewwidth and value

p: Responsive type.
Everything you can do with ^type$ you can do with ^responsive-type$.
Visually hide a text element.
Use ^opacity$ to set ^opacity$ property for old IE and modern browsers.
^ie-rgba$ is for getting rgba property for IE8.
A shorthand @mixin for breakpoints.
Use a single breakpoint (e.g. 800) for both ^min$ and ^max$ instead of two (e.g. 799 for ^max$, 800 for ^min$).
A shorthand @mixin for hide elements on some parts of viewport.

scss: // visible on 500px up on all media

p: A shorthand @mixin for hide elements on some parts of viewport.

scss: // hidden between 300px and 500px, and 700px up on screen

p: Get a contrast ^font-color$ based on the ^background-color$.
^adjacent$ is for creating adjacent colors.
^complementary$ is for getting a complementary color.
^split-complementary$ is for getting split-complementary colors based on a given color.
^triad$ is for getting triad colors based on a given color.
^rectangle$ is for getting rectangle colors based on a given color.
^square$ is for getting square colors based on a given color.
